text: greetings my name is Matt wood and I'm
here at the ADA bears headquarters in
Seattle to give you an update on MX net
MX net is a state-of-the-art deep
learning engine which allows developers
to build sophisticated scalable custom
artificial intelligence systems which
run in the cloud on mobile devices and
on connected devices at the edge
these specialized systems are trained
using a customer's own data usually on
GPUs with custom tuned algorithms born
in academia engines such as MX net make
it easier and faster for developers to
implement and fine-tune artificial
intelligence systems using cutting-edge
approaches such as deep learning last
year we announced that Amazon had
selected MX net as our deep learning
engine of choice because of his ease of
development efficient models and
scalable performance across hundreds of
GPUs since then we've seen a lot of
momentum behind MX net including
autonomous driving image recognition
knowledge engines and medical imaging
today we're pleased to announce another
step forward for the project MX net has
been accepted into the Apache Incubator
this allows MX net to take advantage of
the Apache software foundations process
stewardship outreach and community
events the MX net team in Amazon
proposed the project for incubation and
will continue to be active in its
development going forward as committed
to the project in addition to continuing
to build on the documentation tutorials
and core engine improvements which we
have already contributed if you'd like
to get started with MX net take a look
at the keynote presentation that I gave
at reinvent or fire up an instance or an
entire cluster of the AWS deep learning
army which includes MX net example code
precompiled and ready to roll that's it
thanks a lot
[Music]
